channel.title: iPhone users - new feature in iOS 14.5 - ATT
channel.description:
WSJ delivers a rather snarky review of iOS 14.5. Can any of the tech wizards here, share if they see any downside to the ability to not sharing info across apps that is advertising driven?
https://www.wsj.com/articles/ios-14-5-a-guide-to-apples-new-app-tracking-controls-11619457425?mod=djemalertNEWS

item.title: iPhone users - new feature in iOS 14.5 - ATT
item.dc:creator: davidk01
item.description:
I don’t have an iPhone but this is definitely a good feature. It will force application developers to really think about what data they are gathering and why. Hopefully it will also send a signal to other large companies that people care about privacy and that it should be taken seriously.

Read full topic
item.source: iPhone users - new feature in iOS 14.5 - ATT

item.title: iPhone users - new feature in iOS 14.5 - ATT
item.dc:creator: kenhomer
item.description:
WSJ delivers a rather snarky review of iOS 14.5. Can any of the tech wizards here, share if they see any downside to the ability to not sharing info across apps that is advertising driven?

WSJ

iOS 14.5: A Guide to Apple’s New App-Tracking Controls

The latest update to the iPhone’s operating system has some useful upgrades and one big privacy feature that requires some consideration.
